page.title: 03LOWER DARNFORD BUILDINGS
page.content: All the buildings are stone,brick and slate.The{granary}is above the Cart Shed.The wheatsheaves were stored in one part then they were put into the steam _driven threshing machine.The bags of grain went into the granary and the straw went to the barn.Today it is used as a machine store.The {stables}still have the wooden feeding frames.The doors and windows are broken.The three calf houses are next to the cart shed under the granary and lofts.The troughs are still there.There are two dutch barns and a long open cattle shed.The pig sties are separate from the other buildings.The hayloft over two sties would keep the pigs warm.There was a boiler for slops which were poured through an outside chute.
